intro: Verbesina trinervata, commonly known as the three-veined beggar-ticks, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and serrated leaves. The plant produces yellow-orange composite flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It is often found in disturbed habitats, including roadsides and fields. Verbesina trinervata is also known for its medicinal properties in traditional herbal practices.
